courses.course_desc: Introduction to listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills within an Arabic cultural framework. Students who take ARAB 1410 toward degree requirements must also complete ARAB 1420. (MULT).

courses.course_desc: An introduction to Arab dialects with a focus on Levantine Arabic ( Jordan, Syria, Lebanon, and Palestinian territories). The course will emphasize oral communication and using the dialect correctly in its cultural context. It will also compare Levantine Arabic to Modern Standard Arabic. Repeatable once with different content. (MULT).
courses.course_credits:
3 Credit Hours 
3 Lecture Contact Hours 
0 Lab Contact Hours
courses.course_attributes: Course Attribute(s): Exclude from 3-peat Processing|Multicultural Content

courses.course_desc: Introduction to Arab media designed to advance students' proficiency in Arabic. It will present cultural characteristics of Arab media and describe how those characteristics differ from those of US media. The course will increase students vocabulary knowledge and enable them to understand various Arab media sources. Repeatable once with different content. (MULT).
courses.course_credits:
3 Credit Hours 
3 Lecture Contact Hours 
0 Lab Contact Hours
courses.course_attributes: Course Attribute(s): Exclude from 3-peat Processing|Multicultural Content

courses.course_desc: This course focuses on the use of written Arabic in business contexts, as well as economic, demographic, and cultural factors that influence commercial interactions in the Arabic-speaking world.(MULT) Prerequisite: ARAB 2320 with a grade of "D" or better.
courses.course_credits:
3 Credit Hours 
3 Lecture Contact Hours 
0 Lab Contact Hours

courses.course_desc: Students study the civilizations and cultures of the Arab world. The course provides background for understanding Arab societies.(MULT) Prerequisite: ARAB 2320 with a grade of "D" or better.
courses.course_credits:
3 Credit Hours
